Hi,
if the firefox addon "Adblock plus" is installed (http://adblockplus.org) and the famous filterlist "Cédrics Liste (Deutschland)" is used, then qooxdoo windows/popups are blocked.
To reproduce you can install it (https://addons.mozilla.org/de/firefox/addon/1865) and open the demo browser: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/#example~Window_1.html
I searched the lists entries and saw this one: "#DIV(style*=z-index: 10000)"
Seems like the filter does not allow content above z-index 10 000. I don't know if other lists have a rule like this.

I found this behaviour with adblock when running the source build version of my qooxdoo application.
adblock blocks here the "Popup.js" file where the popup window class is defined.

At least the zIndex filter rule should be submitted as a bug to the author of this list. It is a lot to generic to filter all stuff with a zIndex. This would also block stuff from dojo, extjs etc. as they do something comparable to put stuff on different "layers".

(In reply to comment #2) > At least the zIndex filter rule should be submitted as a bug to the author of > this list. It is a lot to generic to filter all stuff with a zIndex. This would > also block stuff from dojo, extjs etc. as they do something comparable to put > stuff on different "layers".
Seems like "Cédric" did not like his filter rule himself. It is no longer part of his list.
The zIndex rule in the filter set was removed some time ago.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
